Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 03 Nov 2018T-Bills are a form of IOU by the US Treasury. These bills do not pay interest, but can be bought at a discount (eg. $998.2 for $1000) in denominations of $1000 up to $5mil. The entire sum will be realised upon maturity.SSB on the other hand is by the SG Govt and earns interest instead of 'discount'. When you invest $1000, you'll get 2% interest (~$20). SSB in short maturity period is generally not worth since interest is less than 2% and may incur some transactional cost.Both SSB and T-bills are principle guaranteed.0 comments0
